content: No, Gollum is not a golem. Golem is a creature from Jewish folklore that is made of clay or mud, and brought to life through Jewish magic. Gollum is a hobbit, a small, human-like creature in the mythology created by J.R.R. Tolkien. Gollum was originally a hobbit named Sméagol who lived near the Gladden Fields. He became corrupted by the One Ring and became the creature known as Gollum. Gollum is not a golem, but rather a fictional character in a work of fantasy literature.
